english: Dihua (proper name); old ROC name for Ürümqi; enlighten; transform

etymology.description: 迪 (enlighten; guide) + 化 (transform; change) = enlighten-and-transform; also used as ROC-era toponym for Ürümqi.
etymology.interpretation: Combines guiding/enlightening with transformation, yielding a sense of civilizing or converting through instruction. As a place name, 迪化 reflected a political ideal of bringing “enlightening transformation” to the region.

examples.chinese: 历史上，乌鲁木齐曾被称为迪化(歷史上，烏魯木齊曾被稱為迪化)。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐ shàng, Wūlǔmùqí céng bèi chēngwéi Díhuà.
examples.english: Historically, Ürümqi was once called Dihua.

examples.chinese: 政府希望通过教育和文化活动来迪化民众(政府希望通過教育和文化活動來迪化民眾)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ xīwàng tōngguò jiàoyù hé wénhuà huódòng lái díhuà mínzhòng.
examples.english: The government hopes to enlighten and transform the public through education and cultural activities.

examples.chinese: 他以温和的方式迪化了对方的偏见(他以溫和的方式迪化了對方的偏見)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ wēnhé de fāngshì díhuà le duìfāng de piānjiàn.
examples.english: He gently transformed the other side’s prejudice.
